author: Staff Reporter
text:
District police carried out storming operations in all the four sub divisions – Nagercoil, Kanyakumari, Thuckalay and Colachel – on Friday night.

The operations were conducted as per the instructions of the Superintendent of Police, G. Dharmarajan.

Mr. Dharmarajan told The Hindu that the storming operations were conducted right through Friday night.

It has been decided to repeat the storming operations every Friday till the elections are over.

The operations were monitored by two Deputy Superintendents of Police in each sub division.

Vehicle checks were intensified across the district, and as a result 1,098 cases – drunken driving, over speed, riding vehicles without valid license and documents etc – had been filed, the official said.

Cases were registered against 934 persons for driving without wearing helmet and valid documents, 67 booked for drunken driving.

A total of 45 persons moving in a suspicious manner were detained and their fingerprints were taken by the police as a precautionary measure.

Storming operations and the results were aimed at resolving pending cases and to prevent further occurrence of crimes by keeping the criminals at bay, with hardly two months left for the elections, Mr. Dharmarajan said.

Vehicles passing through the inter-district and inter-state border such as Aralvoimozhi, Anjukramam and Kalyakavilai were checked completely at the check posts.

It has been decided to repeat the operations every Friday till elections are over
title: 1,098 cases registered during storming operations
